summary_points: 1. As of August 31, 2025, American Express Company reported a 1.3% 30-day past due loan rate for U.S. Consumer Card Member loans and a 1.6% rate for U.S. Small Business Card Member loans.

2.  The net write-off rate for U.S. Consumer Card Member loans decreased slightly from 2.1% in June 2025 to 2.0% in August 2025, while the rate for U.S. Small Business loans remained relatively stable at around 2.7%.
3. The American Express Credit Account Master Trust reported an annualized default rate, net of recoveries, ranging from 1.1% to 1.3% over the three months ending August 31, 2025.
1. On September 12, 2025, Yvonne McGill resigned from the Applied Materials, Inc. Board of Directors; her resignation was not due to any disagreement with the company.
2.  The filing is an 8-K Current Report, filed on September 15, 2025, reporting an event that occurred on September 12, 2025.
3. No specific future impacts or risks are mentioned in this section of the filing.
1. Senate Bill 254, creating an $18 billion wildfire cost fund split between customers and utilities, was approved on September 13, 2025.
2.  SCE's subrogation settlement for the Eaton Fire reached $500 million by July 31, 2025, representing a 52% payout to insurance claimants.
3. Edison International and SCE must assess new wildfire risk-sharing models by April 1, 2026, due to potential Wildfire Insurance Fund exhaustion and regulatory uncertainty.

1. On September 12, 2025, Intel completed the sale of a 51% stake in its Altera business to an affiliate of Silver Lake for approximately $3.3 billion, retaining a 49% interest in a newly formed limited partnership.
2. Intel revised its full-year 2025 non-GAAP operating expense target to $16.8 billion (from $17 billion) due to the deconsolidation of Altera, while maintaining its 2026 target of $16 billion.

3. Intel's Q3 2025 consolidated financial statements will include Altera's results from June 29, 2025, through September 11, 2025, with Intel using the equity method of accounting for its minority investment in Altera thereafter.
